newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to boost R&D spending.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to boost R&D spending.

text.p: Microsoft Corp expects to boost research and development spending to $2.6 billion in fiscal 1998 from $2.2 billion in the fiscal year just ended.

Incoming Chief Financial Officer Greg Maffei said in notes prepared for presentation to financial analysts here that the company's unearned (deferred) revenues are expected to rise to more than $2 billion at the end of fiscal 1998 from $1.4 billion as of June 30, 1997.

In the notes, distributed at the beginning of the company's annual financial analysts meeting, Maffei said he expected Microsoft's research and development headcount to rise to 11,600 people this year from 8,800 in fiscal 1997.
The projected R&D spending includes spending on joint venture such as its MSNBC news business with General Electric Co's NBC network.
